decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed development, by reason of its design such as the&nbsp;roof form and fenestration detail including window design  is considered to be inconsistent and unreflective of the design and character of the main dwellinghouse and would have&nbsp;harmful to the appearance of the property.&nbsp; Furthermore, the scale, size and siting of the proposed development combined with the&nbsp;existing side extensions, would over double the size of the front elevation of the dwelling making the property and terrace row appear lopsided and unbalanced, this would be at odds with the uniform character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to: </p><ul><li style="">Paragraphs 126&nbsp; and 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;(DLUHC, July 2021) </li><li style="">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021) </li><li style="">Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) </li><li style="">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </li><li style="">Paragraph 5.4 of The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li><li style="">Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>
